document_title: Hiatal hernia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Small hernias usually do not cause symptoms. In case of a large hernia, the patient may experience the following symptoms:
Burning behind the sternum; Spitting food or liquid into the mouth; Stomach or chest pain; Difficulty swallowing; Eat quickly and feel full; Nausea; Shortness of breath; Vomiting blood or having black stools; Unexplained cough
Hiatal hernia can cause symptoms of frequent coughing for unknown reasons
